mil.emp3.mapengine.interfaces

Interface IMapInstance

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CoreMapInstance, MapInstanceBase

    public interface IMapInstance
    This is the interface that must be implemented by all map engines. It represent the interface to one instance of a map implemented by the engine APK The APK must be able to create multiple independent instances at any one time. Each map instance must expose this interface.

        This method is used by the EMP core to retrieve the map engines properties.
        Returns:
        See IMapEngineProperties

      • getCapabilities

        IMapEngineCapabilities getCapabilities()
        This method is called by the EMP core to identify the map instances capabilities. It is used to ensure that the core does NOT attempt an operation on the map engine that it does not support.
        Returns:
        See IMapEngineCapabilities

      • getRequirements

        IMapEngineRequirements getRequirements()
        This method retrieves the map engine's requirement set. It is queried by the core to properly access the map engines capabilities.
        Returns:
        IMapEngineRequirements

      • getCapture

        ICapture getCapture()
        This method is called to retrieve an image of the current viewing area of the map.
        Returns:
        An ICapture object or null if not supported.

      • setVisibility

        void setVisibility(ISetVisibilityList visibilityList)
        This method is called by the core to set the visibility of the features listed to the setting indicated.
        Parameters:
        visibilityList - A list of unique Ids of the affected features and their visibility setting.

      • addFeatures

        void addFeatures(FeatureVisibilityList features)
        This method is called by the EMP core to add features to the map.
        Parameters:
        features - The list of one or more feature to add to the map. See FeatureVisibilityList

      • removeFeatures

        void removeFeatures(IUUIDSet features)
        This method is called by the EMP core to remove features from the map.
        Parameters:
        features - The list of one or more unique Id of features to remove from the map.

      • addMapService

        void addMapService(IMapService mapService)
        This method is called by the EMP core to add a WMS service to the map.
        Parameters:
        mapService - The list of one or more map services to add to the map.

      • removeMapService

        void removeMapService(IMapService mapService)
        This method is called by the EMP core to remove map services from the map.
        Parameters:
        mapService - The list of one or more map services to remove from the map.

      • getCamera

        ICamera getCamera()
        This method is used to retrieve the map current camera.
        Returns:
        See ICamera

      • setCamera

        void setCamera(ICamera oCamera,
             boolean animate)
        This method is used to set the camera for the map. Once the camera values are set in the map, the map registers for camera change events for the camera and must apply the camera changes to the map view on each event.
        Parameters:
        oCamera - The new setting. See ICamera
        animate - If set to true then animate to new position

      • setLookAt

        void setLookAt(ILookAt oLookAt,
             boolean animate)
        This method is used to set the camera for the map. Once the camera values are set in the map, the map registers for camera change events for the camera and must apply the camera changes to the map view on each event.
        Parameters:
        oLookAt - The new setting. See ILookAt
        animate - If set to true then animate to new position

      • getLookAt

        ILookAt getLookAt()
        This method is used to retrieve the map current camera.
        Returns:
        See ILookAt

      • addMapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener

        void addMapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener(MapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener listener)
        This method is called by the core to register a Feature user interaction event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a MapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEvent each time the user performs any of the actions defined in UserInteractionEventEnum on a feature currently visible on the map.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener

      • addMapInstanceStateChangeEventListener

        void addMapInstanceStateChangeEventListener(MapInstanceStateChangeEventListener listener)
        This method is called by the core to register a map state change event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a MapInstanceStateChangeEvent each time the map changes from one state (See MapStateEnum) to another.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceStateChangeEventListener

      • addMapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener

        void addMapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener(MapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener listener)
        This method is called by the core to register a map user interaction event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a MapInstanceUserInteractionEvent each time the user performs any of the actions defined in UserInteractionEventEnum on the map.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener

      • addMapInstanceViewChangeEventListener

        void addMapInstanceViewChangeEventListener(MapInstanceViewChangeEventListener listener)
        This method is called by the core to register a map view change event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a MapInstanceViewChangeEvent each time the map's viewing area is changed. The map engine implementation must ensure that an excessive number of consecutive map view change events are not generated. I.E. continuous view change events due to animation should not be generated.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceViewChangeEventListener

      • addMapInstanceFeatureAddedEventListener

        void addMapInstanceFeatureAddedEventListener(MapInstanceFeatureAddedEventListener listener)

      • addMapInstanceFeatureRemovedEventListener

        void addMapInstanceFeatureRemovedEventListener(MapInstanceFeatureRemovedEventListener listener)

      • setBounds

        void setBounds(org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoBounds bounds)
        This method sets the maps viewing area to the coordinates contained in the bounding box provided. If this was designed for zoomIt support then it should be removed as all calculations are done in the core. Methods getFieldOfView(), getViewHeight() and getViewWidth() were added to this interface for zoomIt support.
        Parameters:
        bounds -

      • setMotionLockMode

        void setMotionLockMode(MapMotionLockEnum mode)
        This method set the map's motion lock.
        Parameters:
        mode - see MapMotionLockEnum

      • registerMilStdRenderer

        void registerMilStdRenderer(IMilStdRenderer oRenderer)
        This method is called by the core to register a MilStd renderer with the map instance. The instance must call this renderer to obtain the basic shapes of a MilStd feature.
        Parameters:
        oRenderer - see IMilStdRenderer

      • getFieldOfView

        double getFieldOfView()
        Returns field of view. Currently used by the core for zoomIt calculations.
        Returns:
        field of view in degrees

      • getViewHeight

        int getViewHeight()
        Returns height of the view. Currently used by the core for zoomIt calculations to adjust camera altitude.
        Returns:

      • getViewWidth

        int getViewWidth()
        Returns height of the view. Currently used by the core for zoomIt calculations to adjust camera altitude.
        Returns:

      • setFarDistanceThreshold

        void setFarDistanceThreshold(double dValue)
        This method sets the threshold of the distances beyond which the map displays MilStd single point icons as dots.
        Parameters:
        dValue - Distance in meters.

      • setMidDistanceThreshold

        void setMidDistanceThreshold(double dValue)
        This method sets the threshold of the distances beyond which the map displays MilStd single point icons with no modifiers. Icons at distances less than this threshold get displayed as fully qualified icons as per the label setting.
        Parameters:
        dValue - Distance in meters.

      • getVersionInformation

        void getVersionInformation(java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> buildConfigFields)
        Returns version information for the map engine

        org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoBounds getMapBounds()
        This method returns the current bounds of the maps viewing area.
        Returns:
        IGeoBounds
